about-us.blend: A Blend of History and Research
about-us.maury: Meet Claude Maury: The Main Editor
about-us.join: Join Us in This Musical Expedition
about-us.at-l'héritage: At L'Héritage du Cor we are passionate about rediscovering and bringing back old music for horn that has been deglected. Our dedication lies in unearthing forgotten works from the 18th and 19th centuries, bringing them back to life for modern horn players, students and audiences. But our journey doesn't end with the rarities; we also offer new, critical editions of well-known works from the horn repertoire.
about-us.every-piece: Every piece in our collection is more than just a score; it's a bridge to the past. Each edition comes with a thoroughly researched introduction, delving into the musical context of both the composer and the composition. This approach provides musicians and enthusiasts alike a deeper understanding of the work, enriching their experience and connection to the music.
about-us.we-believe: We believe in absolute transparency and authenticity. That's why we clearly state the sources of our editions, ensuring that our users can trust the historical accuracy and integrity of our editions. This commitment to authenticity is not just about respecting history – it’s about bringing it to life in the most genuine way possible.
about-us.in-today's: In today’s fast-paced world, access to music should be instant and hassle-free. To meet this modern need, we currently offer our editions in a digital format, delivering them directly to our buyers’ emails. This approach ensures that our precious musical heritage is just a few clicks away, ready to be explored and enjoyed. It's also a small gesture in aknowledging the need for more durable and environmentally friendly solutions.
about-us.our-journey: Our journey of musical rediscovery is spearheaded by the Claude Maury, former Professor of early horns at the Conservatoire National Supérieur de Musique et de Danse de Paris (2006-2020). Prize recipient at the Gallay competition in Perpignan, France (1981), and another in Bad Harzburg, Germany (1984), he embraces a freelancing natural horn career from 1985. He has collaborated with some of the most respected orchestras and ensembles specializing in period instruments, with ensembles such as La Petite Bande, Orchestra of the 18th Century, and Les Musiciens du Louvre, to name a few. His discography includes numerous solo and chamber music CDs, primarily featuring the natural horn. Beyond his performance career, Claude is renowned for his educational contributions. He has been teaching for many years at both Conservatoire de Versailles and the Conservatoire de Paris (CNSMDP).
about-us.we-invite: We invite you to explore our carefully curated collection and experience the rich history of our favorite instrument through our editions. Whether you're a professional musician, a student, or a natural horn enthusiast, our offerings are sure to enrich and inspire your musical journey.
about-us.in-our-commitment: In our commitment to supporting student musicians, we're proud to offer the 'STUDENT50' discount code, granting a 50% discount on all orders. This initiative reflects our dedication to making high-quality music editions accessible to aspiring artists, fostering their growth and passion for musical heritage.
